actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage rate under that act, to provide for an automatic increase in such wage rate based on increases in the price index, to require an overtime rate equal to 2 1/2 times the regular wage rate, and to reduce and then repeal the credit against the minimum wage which is based on tips received by tipped employees.

summary.text: Fair Labor Standards Amendments - Increases the minimum wage rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act to $3.00 per hour until December 31, 1976. Provides for an automatic increase in such wage rate based on increases in the price index. Requires an overtime rate equal to two and one-half times the regular wage rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act. Reduces the credit against the minium wage which is based on tips received by tipped employees. Repeals such credit one year after the effective date of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage rate under that act, to provide for an automatic increase in such wage rate based on increases in the price index, to require an overtime rate equal to 2 1/2 times the regular wage rate, and to reduce and then repeal the credit against the minimum wage which is based on tips received by tipped employees.
